abstract_summ: A comparison was done between the identified top 15 countries for confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries, and an advanced autoregressive integrated moving average (ARIMA) model was used for predicting the COVID-19 disease spread trajectories for the next 2 months.METHODS: The comparison of recent cumulative and predicted cases was done for the top 15 countries with confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries from COVID-19.The comparison of recent cumulative and predicted cases was done for the top 15 countries with confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries from COVID-19.CONCLUSIONS: The observed predicted values showed that the confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries will double in all the observed countries except China, Switzerland, and Germany.The ARIMA model prediction shows that the infected cases in India may reach up to 700 thousands in next 30 days in worst case scenario while most optimistic scenario may restrict the numbers up to 1000-1200.
title_summ: Forecast and interpretation of daily affected people during 21 days lockdown due to COVID 19 pandemic in IndiaForecasting the COVID-19 Pandemic with Climate Variables for Top Five Burdening and Three South Asian CountriesModeling and Short-Term Forecasts of Indicators for COVID-19 Outbreak in 25 Countries at the end of MarchApplying the SEIR Model in Forecasting The COVID-19 Trend in Malaysia: A Preliminary StudyTrend Analysis and Forecasting of COVID-19 outbreak in IndiaCoronavirus Covid-19 spreading in Italy: optimizing an epidemiological model with dynamic social distancing through Differential EvolutionForecasting the cumulative number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Italy, UK and USA using fractional nonlinear grey Bernoulli modelPrediction of the COVID-19 Pandemic for the Top 15 Affected Countries:Advanced Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) Model
title_abstract_phrases: Forecasting the cumulative number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Italy, UK and USA using fractional nonlinear grey Bernoulli modelSince the new coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak spread from China to other countries, it has been a curiosity for how and how long the number of cases will increase.The ARIMA model prediction shows that the infected cases in India may reach up to 700 thousands in next 30 days in worst case scenario while most optimistic scenario may restrict the numbers up to 1000-1200.This study aims to forecast the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Italy, the United Kingdom (UK) and the United States of America (USA).The advanced ARIMA model was used for predicting future data based on time series data.A comparison was done between the identified top 15 countries for confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries, and an advanced autoregressive integrated moving average (ARIMA) model was used for predicting the COVID-19 disease spread trajectories for the next 2 months.
